name: Science and Writing
description: Examines science as rhetoric and the way this rhetoric mixes with other rhetorics from an interdisciplinary perspective appropriate for science students and for humanities and social science students. The course examines scientific writing and journalistic writing about science. Through theory and applied research and writing, students consider the special features of science rhetoric including protocols for research and documentation. This course draws from a range of theorists including Kuhn, Popper, Hempel, Hacking. [24L]
